org.simplug.framework.model
Class Plugin

java.lang.Object
  org.simplug.framework.model.Plugin

public class Plugin
extends java.lang.Object

Core Plugin class. Every Plugin has to extend this class in order to work properly.
This class defines the lifecycle of a plugin and provides some methods made available through the SimPlugContext interface. The lifecycle of a plugin is defined as follows:

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

Plugin

public Plugin()
Method Detail

receiveAndDelegateEvent

public final void receiveAndDelegateEvent(Event event)
This is the core method of a plugin to receive events from the framework. It receives every event and delegates it to the corresponding lifecycle methods of the plugin.
This method is final because there is no need to overwrite in extending plugin classes. The defined plugin lifecycle can not be changed by any plugin.
It delegates the received events using the following scheme:
An InitEventis delegated to the onInit(InitEvent) method.
An InterruptEvent is delegated to the onInterrupt(InterruptEvent) method.
A DestroyEvent is delegated to the onDestroy(DestroyEvent) method.
Every other event received is delegated to the onEventReceived(Event) method.

This method does no validity check on the passed event. It just passes it on.

Parameters:
event - the event to receive and delegate to the plugins lifecycle methods.

fireEvent

public final void fireEvent(Event event)
This methods uses the method implemented by the SimPlugContext.fireEvent(Event) interface in order to fire events on it own.

Parameters:
event - the Event to be fired.
See Also:
SimPlugContext.fireEvent(Event)

onInit

public void onInit(InitEvent event)
This lifecycle method reacts on any InitEvent.
It extracts the SimPlugContext from the event to make it accessible for possible later operations.

Parameters:
event - the InitEvent to be used to initialize the plugin.

onEventReceived

public void onEventReceived(Event event)
This method gets called when no other lifecycle method reacts on an event.
It is responsible for handling every event the plugin registered to.

Parameters:
event - the received Event.

onInterrupt

public void onInterrupt(InterruptEvent event)
This lifecycle method reacts on any InterruptEvent.
An InterruptEvent should be fired to stop any action in the plugin. The stop is not urgent and the plugin still has time to save all collected data or similar. Although it is possible the plugin should not continue to work on a task when it gets an InterruptEvent. It is likely to receive a DestroyEvent right after the InterruptEvent.

Parameters:
event - the received InterruptEvent.

onDestroy

public void onDestroy(DestroyEvent event)
This lifecycle method reacts on any DestroyEvent.
A DestroyEvent immediatly stops the execution of a plugin. No saving of states is possible.

Parameters:
event - the received DestroyEvent.

getContext

public SimPlugContext getContext()
Returns the context bound to this plugin or null if no context is bound.

Returns:
the context bound to this plugin or null if no context is bound.

setContext

public void setContext(SimPlugContext context)
Use this method to bind the plugin to another context different from the one supplied with the initial InitEvent.

Parameters:
context - the context this plugin should be bound to.
